urls.title: EA chair calls for waste crime fines based on turnover | MRW
urls.description: That call has come from Environment Agency chair Emma Howard Boyd, who said regulation would not work unless it was backed up by real financial threats to

tweets.text: The biggest problem @EnvAgency is the number of small to medium sized companies ripping off the landfill tax scheme and leaving illegal dumps because you don‚Äôt regulate, not the majors who have CSR standards. You are totally out of touch @EmmaHowardBoyd https://t.co/6xgmJEHjkN

If you hold an abstraction licence for #irrigation, read on ‚¨áÔ∏è 

The @EnvAgency has updated us on their irrigation prospects for 2021 and it‚Äôs good news üôåüíß

With high water levels, now is time to take action. 
Read on to learn more‚û°Ô∏èhttps://t.co/bma3uFl7KI

#agriculture

Thanks to a successful #fishery improvement prog bid to @EnvAgencyYNE with @WildTroutTrust + grant from @SandTCUKYorks, we fenced top of Hubberholme to protect both banks. Now, planting trees for shade & cover. Angler access improved. Roll on trout season https://t.co/QaUaVP33yk

Interesting quote, like to understand the definition of "alone" in March 2020 @RiverChess had sewage discharges for all 31 days, of which 21 were dry days. Because it had rained the previous month the @EnvAgency deeded all discharges were permitted.  "Alone" stopped on 1st April. https://t.co/XJEGta2Imp

Did you know? Silt and mud pollution can cause serious harm to aquatic species. This includes smothering the habitat for invertebrates and gravel substrates available for fish spawning. If you witness any type of pollution taking place please contact us 24/7 on 0800 807060. https://t.co/U3j7YcxkDE

Dunston Beck project is well on its way, with top soil stripped back and the formation of the bends clear from our photos. The variation in depths and flow patterns will sort the sands and gravel on the riverbed, improving water quality and delivering benefits to the ecosystem. https://t.co/2xQHYILh7i

urls.title: Get involved in the National Waste Crime Survey 2021
urls.description: Farmers impacted by large-scale waste crime are being urged to give their views through a new survey which will aid the fight against criminal activity.

tweets.text: We're asking our members who have been impacted by large-scale waste crime to take part in the @EnvAgency's National Waste Crime Survey 2021. You have until the 22 March to have your say. Visit NFU Online for further details üëâ https://t.co/5lQzDPg2IU https://t.co/06vC4DnTTG

We want to ensure water companies provide a sustainable supply of water to their customers, while protecting and enhancing the environment.

We've published guidelines for water companies to use for their water resources management plans.

Read them here: https://t.co/w60et6JxQ1 https://t.co/02C4xH5X65

Can you help us in our fight against #WasteCrime? 

We've launched a Waste Crime Survey to help us build a better intelligence picture across the country. 

Your responses will be kept confidential and anonymous. 

Complete the survey here: https://t.co/THxMyWjzgX https://t.co/2s6TGQONnn

urls.title: Work has begun on 'natural dams' flood management scheme in Whinlatter Forest | ITV News
urls.description: More than 200 dams are being installed by West Cumbria Rivers Trust. The project aims to slow the flow of water towards Lorton and the River Cocker.

urls.title: Thames Water fined ¬£2.3m for Henley fish-death pollution
urls.description: The water company apologises for polluting a river with sewage in Henley-on-Thames.

urls.title: Thames Water fined ¬£2.3 million after 'foreseeable' pollution killed 1,144 fish
urls.description: THAMES Water has been slapped with a ¬£2.3 million fine after sewage poured into stream killing more than 1,000 fish.

tweets.text: We are responding to a pollution incident at Cardinham Water, Bodmin following the theft of diesel oil from a distribution depot. Absorbent pads and booms have been deployed in the river to reduce any environmental impact. The watercourse is a tributary of the River Fowey. https://t.co/LyDV8vYubC
